1.text: And Job will answer and say,

2.text: I would weighing, my anger shall be weighed, and my falls shall be lifted up in the balances together.

3.text: For now it will be heavy above the sand of the seas: for this my words were rash.

4.text: For the arrows of the Almighty are with me, which their anger drank up my spirit: the terrors of God will be prepared for me.

5.text: Shall the wild ass bray at grass? if the ox will low over his provender?

6.text: Shall that unseasoned be eaten without salt? if there is taste in purslain slime?

7.text: My soul refused to touch these as the loathsomeness of my bread.

8.text: Who will give my asking shall come? and will God give my expectation?

9.text: And God will, and he will crush me; will he let his hand remain, and will he cut me off?

10.text: And it will yet be my consolation, and I shall exult in pain: he will not spare; for I hid not the words of of the Holy One.

11.text: For what my strength that I shall wait and what my end, that I shall prolong my soul?

12.text: If my strength the strength of stones? if my flesh of brass?

13.text: And if not my help in me? and deliverance fled from me?

14.text: To him melting, mercy from his friend; and he will forsake the fear of the Almighty.

15.text: My brethren dealt faithlessly as a torrent; as a channel of torrents they shall pass away;

16.text: Being darkened because of ice, upon them the snow will be hid:

17.text: In the time they will flow of they became extinct: in its heat they were extinguished from their place.

18.text: The paths of their way will turn aside; they will go up into desolation and perish.

19.text: Behold the paths of Tema; the goings of Sheba, wait ye for them.

20.text: They were ashamed for trusting; they came even to it, they will be put to shame.

21.text: For now ye were not: ye shall see the terror and be afraid.

22.text: For did I say, Give to me? and from your strength make ye a present for me?

23.text: And deliver me from the hand of the enemy? and from the hand of the strong ye shall redeem me?

24.text: each ye me, and I will be silent: and what I erred in, cause me to understand.

25.text: How forcible were words of uprightness! and what will reproving from you prove?

26.text: Will ye purpose to reprove words, and for the spirit of the words of him despairing?

27.text: But ye will cause the orphans to fall, and ye will dig for your friend.

28.text: And now be content, look upon me; and before your face if I shall lie;

29.text: Turn ye back now, it shall not be iniquity; and turn back yet, my justice is in it.

30.text: Is there iniquity in my tongue? if my palate shall not understand calamities.
